Terminology:  
1. JDK 
2. JRE 
3. JVM  
JDK : 
¾ Java Development  Kit 
¾ If run any applications we need JDK have to installed  
¾ JDK versions: 1.0   to 1.9 
¾ Mostly  V1.8  is used now  
JRE : 
¾ Java Runtime Environment  
¾ It is a pre-defined . class files  (i.e.) library files  
JVM : 
¾ Java Virtual Machine  
¾ It is mainly used to allocate the memory and compiling  
TOOLS : 
1. Notepad  
2. Net bean  
3. Eclipse  
4. J Developer -oracle  
5. RAD -IBM  
¾ Nowadays we mostly used eclipse ( 75% of the people using ). 
¾ Versions  of eclipse : 
x Juno

OOPS CONCEPT : 
¾ Object Oriented Programing Structure  
¾ OOPS is a method of implementation in which programs are organized  as collection of objects, class 
and methods

Page 5     
Oops principles are  
1. Class  
2. Method  
3. Object  
4. Abstraction  
5. Encapsulation  
6. Inheritance  
7. Polymorphism  
 
CLASS:  
¾ Class is nothing but collection of methods or collection of objects.  
x Project name  :  Should be in Pasc al notation  
x Pascal notation  : Each word of  the first letter should be in capital  
x src - Source file  
x Class name:  Pascal  notation  
x Package  creation: ex, org.cts.scope -All small letters   
Syntax :  
(First type class name and click ctrl  +space)  
public class Bank  { 
 
}  // Bank is a class name  
 
Public -Access specifier  
METHOD:  
¾ Set of action to be performed  
Method  name: camel notation
